channel.title: TravelgateX Documentation â€“ Scalars
channel.description: Recent changes in Scalars on TravelgateX Documentation

item.title: Flight-X: AirlineCode
item.description: 2-letters IATA airline code GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: Arrival
item.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station. GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: Boolean
item.description: The Boolean scalar type represents true or false. GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: Departure
item.description: IATA defined code identifying a city or station. GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: FlightNumber
item.description: 4 digits or less that are unique flight codes in a day. GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: Float
item.description: The Float scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by IEEE 754. GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: ID
item.description: The ID scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID. GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: Int
item.description: The Int scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1. GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: LocationCode
item.description: IATA Location Code. GraphQL schema definition

item.title: Flight-X: String
item.description: The String scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text. GraphQL schema definition
